characters.etymology: Mouth (口) divided (八) = only this one, separated from all others
characters.pithy_formula: ONLY one remains - I GROAN 'Jihhh...' alone in the dark.
characters.story: ONLY one survivor remains. I GROAN 'Jihhh...' in low, creaky despair - everyone else is gone. Just me, ONLY me, my zombie moan echoing in the emptiness.

characters.etymology: Pictograph of a cowrie shell - ancient Chinese currency
characters.pithy_formula: I SMASH the SHELL and COMMAND 'BAY!' - pay me NOW!
characters.story: I SMASH the cowrie SHELL on the table and COMMAND 'BAY!' - this is money, this is value! The sharp crack demands payment. Ancient currency, violent transaction.

characters.etymology: Shell (貝) + stick/divine (占) = to paste (shells strung on sticks)
characters.pithy_formula: I PASTE shells together, SINGING 'TYEHHH!' as the glue holds.
characters.story: I PASTE the shells together on a string, SINGING 'TYEHHH!' in a sustained note. The glue holds, the shells stick - my voice rings out as I thread ancient money.

characters.etymology: Divination (卜) + shell (貝) = chaste (pure as oracle reading)
characters.pithy_formula: The CHASTE one SINGS 'JENNNN!' - pure as the oracle's truth.
characters.story: The CHASTE maiden stands before the oracle, SINGING 'JENNNN!' in a pure, sustained note. Her virtue rings true - the divination shells confirm her purity.

characters.etymology: Mouth (口) + shell/money (貝) = employee (one who is paid)
characters.pithy_formula: The EMPLOYEE sees empty pay - I GASP 'YWEN?!' Where's my money?!
characters.story: I open my paycheck and GASP 'YWEN?!' in rising shock - the EMPLOYEE has been cheated! My voice climbs upward as I stare at the empty shell. Robbed!

similar_warning.repulsion: 員 has SHELL (貝) = paid employee; 元 has LEGS (儿) = walking origin

characters.etymology: Eye (目) on legs (儿) = to see (walking eye, actively looking)
characters.pithy_formula: I SEE the horror and COMMAND 'JYEN!' - look at THIS!
characters.story: My eyes on legs march forward - I SEE the carnage and COMMAND 'JYEN!' with a sharp bark. LOOK at this! The seeing is violent, the command absolute.

characters.etymology: Two (二) + legs (儿) = beginning (first steps, primal origin)
characters.pithy_formula: At the BEGINNING I GASP 'YWEN?!' - where did it all start?!
characters.story: I stumble upon the BEGINNING of everything and GASP 'YWEN?!' in rising awe. The origin point! My voice climbs as I witness the first moment of creation.

similar_warning.repulsion: 元 has LEGS (儿) = walking origin; 員 has SHELL (貝) = paid worker

characters.etymology: Head radical - pages are 'heads' of documents
characters.pithy_formula: I RIP the PAGE and COMMAND 'YEH!' - turn it NOW!
characters.story: I RIP the PAGE from the book and COMMAND 'YEH!' with sharp force. The paper tears - a head removed from the body of text. Decisive, violent reading.

similar_warning.repulsion: 頁 = page/document head (flat top); 首 = physical head (with hair strokes)

characters.etymology: Origin (元) + head (頁) = stubborn (hard-headed from the start)
characters.pithy_formula: The STUBBORN head won't move - I GASP 'WAHN?!' in shock!
characters.story: I push the STUBBORN head but it won't budge. I GASP 'WAHN?!' in rising frustration - hard-headed from birth! My voice climbs as I strain against immovable will.

characters.etymology: Simple vessel shape = ordinary, common, nothing special
characters.pithy_formula: Just ORDINARY - I GASP 'FAHN?!' Am I really this plain?!
characters.story: I look in the mirror and GASP 'FAHN?!' in rising dismay - just ORDINARY! Nothing special, nothing unique. My voice climbs with the shock of being utterly common.

characters.etymology: Flesh (月) on frame (几) = muscle (meat on bones)
characters.moon_flesh_note: 月 on the LEFT means FLESH, not moon
characters.pithy_formula: I FLEX my MUSCLE and SING 'JEEE!' - feel this power!
characters.story: I FLEX my MUSCLE and SING 'JEEE!' in a sustained high note. The flesh ripples over the frame of bone - raw power, sustained glory, my voice matching the display.

characters.etymology: Burden/knife on shell = defeated (lost money), carrying debt on back
characters.pithy_formula: DEFEATED, I COMMAND 'FOO!' as the debt crushes my back!
characters.story: I collapse under the weight of debt - DEFEATED! I COMMAND 'FOO!' with a sharp bark of rage. The shell-money I owe crushes my spine. Lost, burdened, broken.

characters.pithy_formula: Everything UNIFORM - I GASP 'YOON?!' at perfect equality!
characters.story: I spread the paint and GASP 'YOON?!' in rising surprise - it's perfectly UNIFORM! Every inch identical, every surface even. My voice rises at impossible equality.

characters.etymology: Wrap (勹) + mouth (口) = sentence (words wrapped by mouth)
characters.pithy_formula: I SPIT the SENTENCE out and COMMAND 'JOO!' - hear my words!
characters.story: I SPIT the SENTENCE out like a weapon, COMMANDING 'JOO!' with sharp finality. Words wrapped tight, launched from my mouth - the sentence lands like a verdict.

similar_warning.repulsion: 句 wraps MOUTH (口) = sentence; 旬 wraps SUN (日) = ten days

characters.etymology: Wrap (勹) + sun/day (日) = ten days (wrapped period of time)
characters.pithy_formula: TEN DAYS vanish - I GASP 'SHOON?!' Where did time go?!
characters.story: TEN DAYS have vanished in a blink. I GASP 'SHOON?!' in rising panic - where did the time go?! A wrapped bundle of suns, stolen from my life.

similar_warning.repulsion: 旬 wraps SUN (日) = ten days; 句 wraps MOUTH (口) = sentence

characters.etymology: Scoop shape (勹) with contents (丶) = ladle
characters.pithy_formula: I scoop with the LADLE and GASP 'SHAO?!' - what IS this?!
characters.story: I scoop with the LADLE and GASP 'SHAO?!' in rising horror - what IS this slime?! The contents drip, my voice climbing with each viscous drop.

characters.etymology: White (白) + ladle (勺) = bull's eye (white center of target)
characters.pithy_formula: The arrow hits the BULL'S EYE - I mutter 'duh' - obvious shot.
characters.story: The arrow strikes the white center - BULL'S EYE. I mutter 'duh' with neutral indifference. Of course it hit. The possessive particle of victory, unstressed, thrown away.

characters.etymology: Hair on top of self/nose = head (top of the body)
characters.pithy_formula: The severed HEAD GROANS 'Showww...' from the basket.
characters.story: The severed HEAD rolls into the basket and GROANS 'Showww...' in low, creaky agony. Hair matted, eyes open - the zombie head moans from deep in its throat.

similar_warning.repulsion: 首 = physical head (hair strokes on top); 頁 = document head (flat top)

lesson_palace.description: An ancient trading post where shells are currency and debts are paid in blood

character_stations.只: Isolation cell: only one prisoner remains
character_stations.貝: Treasury vault: cowrie shells piled high
character_stations.貼: Craftsman's bench: shells pasted onto strings
character_stations.貞: Oracle chamber: chaste maiden before the shells
character_stations.員: Payroll office: employees check empty envelopes
character_stations.見: Watchtower: eyes on legs patrol the grounds
character_stations.元: Genesis room: the origin point of all trade
character_stations.頁: Archive: pages torn from ancient ledgers
character_stations.頑: Negotiation room: stubborn heads refuse to deal
character_stations.凡: Common quarters: ordinary workers sleep here
character_stations.肌: Training yard: muscles flex and shine
character_stations.負: Debtor's pit: the defeated carry crushing loads
character_stations.旬: Calendar wall: ten-day periods marked off
character_stations.的: Target range: arrows strike white centers
character_stations.首: Trophy room: severed heads in baskets
